tool.tooldesc: Upload a file eg. Word, Powerpoint, PDF

Ease.desc: Easy. Like an email attachment, but can your document stand on its own?

Xfer.desc: Yes. Only tutors can upload files to modules, so this is definitely a "push" tool.

Assess.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Comms.desc: No. Its a distribution tool. No option for interaction or 2-way communication.

Create.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Blooms.desc: None. This is not a learning activity, but information transfer.

tool.tooldesc: Upload a group of files

Ease.desc: Easy. Like an email attachment, but can your documents stand on their own?

Xfer.desc: Yes. Only tutors can upload a folder of files, so this is definitely a "push" tool.

Assess.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Comms.desc: No. Its a distribution tool. No option for interaction or 2-way communication.

Create.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Blooms.desc: None. This is not a learning activity, but information transfer.

tool.tooldesc: Create a webpage in Moodle

Ease.desc: Easy, just create the page using the HTML editor, adding multi- media if needed.

Xfer.desc: Yes. Only teachers can create the page. So definitely a push-tool.

Assess.desc: Maybe. Use to give task. Collect student files through Forum or Assignment.

Comms.desc: Maybe. Embed or link to interactive web2.0 widgets into the page eg Voicethread.

Create.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Blooms.desc: None. This is not a learning activity, but information transfer.

tool.tooldesc: Create a series of linked chapters as webapges

Ease.desc: Easy, just create a set of pages using the editor. Embed media if required.

Xfer.desc: A way to present information to students. Can be printed by chapter or as full book.

Assess.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Comms.desc: Maybe. Embed or link to interactive web2.0 widgets into the page eg Voicethread.

Create.desc: Maybe. You can link to external collaborative sites e.g. GoogleDocs, or wikis and blogs.

Blooms.desc: None. This is not a learning activity, but information transfer.

tool.tooldesc: Create a link to a webpage

Ease.desc: Easy, find the web address (aka url – the bit that starts with http://), copy it, paste it.

Xfer.desc: Very easy way of directing students to information outside of Moodle.

Assess.desc: Not directly. Option is to link to external activities such as student e- portfolios and blogs.

Comms.desc: Maybe. Link to external tools eg Google Calendar, groups, blogs or wikis.

Create.desc: Maybe. Use to give a task. Student files can be collected through forums or assignments.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Can do all of the above, depending on where you link to.

tool.tooldesc: Use to enable collaborative page creation

Ease.desc: Tricky. Decide on individual and group settings. Can be hard to master. Get some training.

Xfer.desc: Yes. Use as information site. Allow editing only by teachers or by any participant.

Assess.desc: Wiki is versatile and allows this with some planning, e.g. design a formative assessment activity.

Comms.desc: Not suited for discussions. Use in brainstorming, planning, collaborative writing,...

Create.desc: Yes. Students can collaborate and explore topics, discuss them and write together.

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Understand, Apply, Analyse, Evaluate, Create.

tool.tooldesc: Use for learning activities that gaterh resources or present information

Ease.desc: Default settings are good. Try to set it so the author’s name is shown.

Xfer.desc: Use glossary to define terms or present info. Better yet, let the students add to it.

Assess.desc: Glossary is versatile and allows this. But you need to design the right learning activity.

Comms.desc: Not suited for discussions. Students can read other entries and comment or rate.

Create.desc: Tutors and learners can contribute to the glossary, and can also add reviews/comments to entries

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Understand, Apply, Analyse, Evaluate, Create

tool.tooldesc: Allow students to collect, share and search created artifacts

Ease.desc: Tricky to set up. Know what you want before you build. Get some training.

Xfer.desc: Can be used for teacher to present info, but better to let the students add to it.

Assess.desc: Database is versatile and allows this. But you need to design the right learning activity.

Comms.desc: Not suited for discussions. Students can read other entries and comment or rate.

Create.desc: Students can share info and files in searchable way. Create joint collections.

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Understand, Apply, Analyse, Evaluate, Create

tool.tooldesc: Use to gather data from students about teaching of the course

Ease.desc: Easy. Choose from 3 types to assess Attitudes, Incidents and Constructivism.

Xfer.desc: No. The survey tool is not a distribution channel.

Assess.desc: Not directly. Used for gathering feedback to help improve the course.

Comms.desc: No. Only allows one way communication from student to teacher.

Create.desc: No this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Blooms.desc: 2/6 Indirectly helps student analyse and evaluate the learning.

tool.tooldesc: Use to gather data from students on any topic

Ease.desc: Easy but takes time. Configure and then add questions.

Xfer.desc: No. The Feedback tool is not a distribution channel.

Assess.desc: Yes. Use to have students self- assess their understanding before and after.

Comms.desc: No. Only allows one way communication from student to teacher.

Create.desc: No this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Can do all 6 but this requires you to be creative in your approach.

tool.tooldesc: Use for student decision making, voting and topic selection.

Ease.desc: Easy. Define the options and whether you want to limit numbers per choice or not.

Xfer.desc: No. The Choice is best assessing and querying the students on a topic.

Assess.desc: Use choice to quickly test understanding, like mulitple choice questions.

Comms.desc: No. Tip: Use the forum or chat instead.

Create.desc: No. Tip: Use forums, glossaries or wikis instead.

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Can do 5 but this requires you to be creative in your usage.

tool.tooldesc: Use to assess learning - formative or summative

Ease.desc: Tricky and takes time. Set up quiz, then questions. Consider your categories.

Xfer.desc: The quiz is aimed at assessment, not as distribution channel. Tip: use as self-diagnostic.

Assess.desc: Quiz can be timed and secure. Has essay, mc, true/false, matching, and other questions.

Comms.desc: No. Tip: Use forums instead.

Create.desc: No. Tip: Use forums or wikis instead.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Can do all 6 but this requires you to be creative in your assessment.

tool.tooldesc: Use for presenting branched scenarios or testing

Ease.desc: It can be tricky to set up, make sure you plan the lesson first. Worth the effort.

Xfer.desc: Great to present information in a branched, guided way. Implement adaptive learning.

Assess.desc: Yes, allows grading. Use as branched quiz, scenario, case study, role play.

Comms.desc: No this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Create.desc: No this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Can do all 6 but this requires you to be creative in your assessment.

tool.tooldesc: Use to collect, assess and provide feedback on assignments

Ease.desc: Easy. Choose from 4 types. Both online and offline assignments are possible.

Xfer.desc: No. However can include contextual content for the assignment.

Assess.desc: Yes. Set due dates and maximum grades. Collect assignments and provide feedback.

Comms.desc: No. Only allows very limited interaction between teacher and student.

Create.desc: Assignments can be set up as group submissions

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Indirectly. Depends on your assessment design.

tool.tooldesc: Use to collect, assess and generate peer reviews of student work

Ease.desc: Tricky and takes planning and time. 4 stages to follow for setting it up.

Xfer.desc: No. Better to use another tool for this.

Assess.desc: Yes. Students can be assessed on their contribution and on their review of others.

Comms.desc: No. Allows for feedback but overall limited interaction.

Create.desc: No. Currently it does not allow group assignments. Use forum or wiki.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Indirectly. Depends on your assessment design.

tool.tooldesc: Use to present content, media and assess retention

Ease.desc: Can be tricky to make before adding to Moodle, uses 3rd party application.

Xfer.desc: Yes. Great for presenting multimedia content and animations.

Assess.desc: Yes, allows grading. Can embed questions and interactive challenges.

Comms.desc: No. this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Create.desc: No this is an individual activity, not a group activity.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 Can do all 6 but requires you to creatively design a learning object.

tool.tooldesc: Hold real-time text chat discussions

Ease.desc: Easy to set up, requires some effort to manage.

Xfer.desc: Use for invited speakers. High speed message volume. Risk of non-interaction.

Assess.desc: Chat is versatile. Can use in formative assessment activities.

Comms.desc: Yes. Hold debates, small group review sessions and hold drop-in session for Q+A.

Create.desc: Yes. Students can collaborate and explore topics, discuss them and write together.

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Understand, Apply, Analyse, Evaluate, Create

tool.tooldesc: Use for many types of learning activities

Ease.desc: Easy. Forum has usable default settings. A name and description is enough.

Xfer.desc: Share resources as links or files. High message volume? Risk of losing info.

Assess.desc: Forum is versatile and allows this, eg. design a formative assessment activity.

Comms.desc: Yes. Students communicate with you and peers. Interact as a class or in groups.

Create.desc: Yes. Students can collaborate and explore topics, discuss them and write together.

Blooms.desc: 5/6 Understand, Apply, Analyse, Evaluate, Create

tool.tooldesc: Use to connect to a 3rd party learning activity

Ease.desc: Requires access to the external tool before configuring.

Xfer.desc: This depends on the tool that it connects to – it could be anything.

Assess.desc: Yes, but the Tool must pass back the grades into Moodle to be recorded.

Comms.desc: Maybe. If the tool provides options for interaction and communication.

Create.desc: Maybe. If the tool is a collaborative environment like Mediawiki or Drupal.

Blooms.desc: 6/6 This can be anything – depends on the connected Tool.

tool.tooldesc: Insert text and multimedia

Ease.desc: Easy, improve the course page layout.

Xfer.desc: Yes. Only teachers can insert content. So definitely a push-tool.

Assess.desc: Not directly. To be used to describe a task or transmit information.

Comms.desc: No. It's a distribution tool. No option for interaction.

Create.desc: Not directly. To be used to describe a task or transmit information.

Blooms.desc: None. This is not a learning activity.
